definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Plus, although she's a vampire, she doesn't go around killing innocent humans.
sentences.chinese: 最后，尽管她是一名吸血鬼，她并没有滥杀无辜人类。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty the monk misunderstands Sun Wu empty excessive to kill however innocent, chase its a division door.
sentences.chinese: 唐僧却误会孙悟空滥杀无辜，将其逐出师门。

sentences.english: I became famous for my unfair slaughtering of the innocent.
sentences.chinese: 因为我滥杀无辜，我变得很有名气。

definition: death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. to kill people like scything flax (idiom)/fig. to kill people like flies
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
